title: Interaction Education Design for Learners with Mild Intellectual Disabilities Using Humanoid Robot Assistance

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening the capability to design language learning environments using humanoid robot feedback for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields

learning_goals: Learners can analyze various feedback types (voice, gestures, visual expressions) of humanoid robots to evaluate responses from learners with mild intellectual disabilities
Learners apply the ASSURE model to design robot-assisted language education activities, enhancing their ability to develop interactive scenarios
Learners can utilize engagement measurement tools for learners with mild intellectual disabilities in robot-based learning environments through group activities

resources: One NAO or Pepper Humanoid Robot

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
